com.pb.sawdust.util.sql

Class IsolatedResultSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.sql.wrappers.WrappedResultSet
      • com.pb.sawdust.util.sql.IsolatedResultSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.sql.ResultSet, java.sql.Wrapper

    public class IsolatedResultSet
extends WrappedResultSet
    The IsolatedResultSet class provides a framework through which resources used to generate a ResultSet can be freed up through a single method call. Specifically, the java.sql.Connection and (if used) java.sql.Statement used to create a result set are closed automatically when the close() method is called. This means that these resources cannot be directly used again, however for one-off result sets this class provides some convenience by wrapping the multiple close statement idiom into a singel method call.

    The close method may be set to ignore java.sql.SQLExceptions thrown during the close call (the default), or it may capture them and rethrow them after all attempts to close resources have finished.

    • Method Detail

      • setRethrowCloseExceptions

        public void setRethrowCloseExceptions(boolean rethrowCloseExceptions)
        Set whether result set should rethrow exceptions encountered during close() calls, or suppress them.
        Parameters:
        rethrowCloseExceptions - If true, exceptions caught during a close() call will be rethrown, if false, they will be supressed.

      • close

        public void close()
        This method will close the resources used to generate the result set, along with the result set. If any exceptions are encountered during the resource closings, they will be caught; if the class has been set to rethrow close exceptions (via setRethrowCloseExceptions(true)), then they'll be rethrown, otherwise they are suppressed. The rethrown exceptions will be wrapped in the form of a MultiException.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.sql.ResultSet
        Overrides:
        close in class WrappedResultSet
